is a small town in Northern

Smithfield is a small town in Northern Rhode Island that was founded in the 1600’s as a farming town. Smithfield was named after John Smith, "The Miller", who was granted land by the founder of Rhode Island, Roger Williams. Prior to his arrival, Smithfield was originally known as Wionkhiege by the Wampanoag Tribe who utilized the land for its vast hunting and fishing land. Now the town still has the charm of an old farming village with orchards and farms scattered throughout, but it has since been modernized to a mid-size suburban town. The town is also known for its historic mill history. Smithfield’s public schools consist of Smithfield High School, Gallagher Middle School, Old County Elementary school, William Winsor Elementary School, Anna McCabe Elementary School, and La Perch Elementary School. It is made up of six historic villages including Georgiaville, Mountaindale, Esmond, Greenville, Hanton City, and Stillwater. The town is a great place to visit especially in the autumn months for its farms and orchards (known for their apple orchards especially). It is also has many unique places and family-owned businesses that make visitors feel like they are home no matter how far they’ve traveled from.

value: , 2000 Post Road, Warwick, RI 02886. +1-888-268-7222. Rhode Island's major airport is 19 miles from Smithfield, and about a 20 minute drive on the highway.

, 100 Gaspee Street, Providence, RI 02903. +1-800-872-7245. This is also a 15-20 minute drive to Smithfield depending upon traffic which unfortunately is abundant in Providence. Especially, around five o’clock and 6-9AM
, 265 Melrose Street, Providence, RI 02907. 401-781-9400. Routes to and from Smithfield. The cost is $2 per ride. Bus lines include:
Line #90 Smithfield Commons Park N' Ride
Route 44 is a major highway that runs through Connecticut, Massachusetts, and the heart of Smithfield.
Route 7 is another major highway that runs through Connecticut and Rhode Island, just outside of Smithfield. It provides access to Bryant University and the outskirts of the town of Smithfield.

The easiest way to travel in Smithfield is by car or taxi. Biking is a reasonable alternative, but walking is not suggested. Car rental services are limited within Smithfield, but near-by city Providence has all of the major car rental corporations including: Enterprise, Hertz, and Avis.

value: content=This historic house was built in 1696, it is a house museum and is home to the Smithfield Historical Society. Elish Smith, grandson of one of Rhode Island’s co-founders, John Smith, originally built it. Tours are available on scheduled days, otherwise they are done by appointment. When major events are held here, the Smithfield Historic Society dresses up in colonial garb and gives tours to the public.

content=Smithfield is a town that thrives in the fall season with the many apple orchards and farms. As with most of New England, the Autumnal leaf changing is considered by many to be extremely beautiful. The wooded back roads of the town are excellent for a slow drive to admire the foliage.

content=The Audubon Society is a collection of small nature preserves around Rhode Island.  Originally founded in 1897 to slow and stop the killing of native birds.  Separate from the National Audubon Society, this collection of protected natural habitats contain a series of hiking paths that are open to the public and free.

content=Smithfield has many orchards and farms including Knights Farm (1 Snake Hill Road, North Scituate, RI 02875. +1 401-349-4405) Steere Orchard (150 Austin Ave., Greenville, RI, 02828. +1 (401)-949-1456), Jaswell’s Farm (50 Swan Rd. Smithfield, RI, 02917.+1 401 231-9043), Appleland Orchard (135 Smith Avenue
Smithfield, RI 02828. +1 401-949-3690. These farms have apple orchards and pumpkin patches that are full of green leaves and acres of trees. There are many open fields along with these farms that have views including wild flowers, different types of trees and historic stone walls built by early farmers.

content=Smithfield has many historic mills such as the Georgia Cotton Mill (in Georgiaville near Higgins St.) and the Allenville Mill. The Georgia Cotton Mill was built in 1813, and is one of the earliest stone factories in RI. Some mills are interesting to see for their historical construction/techniques.

content=This house was built in 1865 and is located at 108 Farnum Pike Smithfield, RI. It is in the village of Georgiaville and is a two story completely octagonal home. This is interesting to look at for its type of construction and historic value.

content=There are 117 historic cemeteries in the town of Smithfield. Although some are very run down and old, they serve an interesting historical purpose. Gravesites are usually set back in the woods and there is usually different types of moss on the head stones.

.  Also known as the Stillwater Reservoir, this is a great local spot for fishing and kayaking.  Please note that a fishing license must be obtained for about $20.  Licenses are sold in Dick's Sporting Goods in the Smithfield Crossings.

content=The ice rink rents ice time to local youth, high school and adult groups. They also have open skate times for the general public. During the winter months, the ice rink is popular because of the local hockey games that are played on the weekends.

.  (Seasonal) The town has many farms for apple picking in the fall. They each have their own charm, whether it is apple picking, peach picking, pumpkin picking, hay rides, homemade pies and cider and many more great seasonal treats. Here is a list of orchards to check out. Steere Orchard 150 Austin Ave +1 (401) 949-1456, which claims to be the largest apple orchard in Rhode Island.  Matteo's Farm 90 Swan Road +1 (401) 231-4393, Knight Farm on Rt. 116 +1 (401) 949-0234, Jaswell's Farm on Swan Road +1 (401) 231-9043, and Appleland Orchard on Smith Avenue +1 (401) 949-3690.  Please be aware that some of the orchards have picking and their other activities available by appointment only.

.  It is a small town beach right on Georgiaville pond, which is open in the summer months for families and friends to go swimming. It is a small beach with town lifeguards to escape on a hot summer day. There is also a boat launch perfect for small fishing boats, canoes, or kayaks. There is a natural freshwater waterfall if you take a walk past the beach and around the water's perimeter.

.  This is a beautiful park with recreational facilities such as basketball courts, soccer fields and a baseball field. There is also a playground for children. Every Fourth of July there is also a great fireworks display put on by the town in this park.

content=The YMCA provides for public swimming, swimming lessons, summer camps for children, swim team, exercise center and daycare. The gym here is small and does not have air conditioning. Usually it is geared toward older residents. Recently, the pool was renovated and is up to standard now. There is a large playground outside and basketball courts. There are also volleyball courts.

content=It has one little league field, 1 big league field, and 3 softball fields. The park is well kept with green, neat fields. The concession stand serves, hot dogs, burgers, snacks, candy and drinks. Most used little league field in the town out of 6.
address=14 Water Carey Rd. Smithfield RI 02917

content=This is a club where people go to hunt, shoot targets, and fish. It was founded in 1917 and now has over 300 members. It has annual field days and rabbit hunts. This establishment is set back into the woods.

content=Located on the corner of Farnum Pike (route 104) and Esmond Street. While Esmond Park may not be the most “good looking” park you've ever been to, it does have some features that make it a good place to hang out if you are in the area. The park includes, an arching bridge, a small waterfall, picnic tables, benches, cattail marsh, walking paths, WWI monuments and the Woonasquatucket River runs through the park. The park is good for walking and casual conversation. Its location is not ideal but the park serves as a nice relaxation spot according to locals.

.Smithfield has several conservation areas where locals can bike, walk, and see all of the woodland scenery. Mowry Conservation Area. You can enter this walking path along Old Forge Road which is located between Farnum Pike and Log Road. Connors Farm Conservation Area. This neighborhood area called Connors Farm is located off of Mann School Road and there is a sign at the entrance of the pathway towards the middle of the U-Shaped development that leads to the conservation area. Both conservation areas possess clear signs at the entrances and there are pathways so you do not have to worry about trespassing onto private property.

content=Bryant University was established in 1863. The schools of academics include: College of Arts and Sciences, College of Business, and The Graduate School of Business. Both bachelor and master degrees are offered and part-time degree programs are available. In 2008, The university has 3,364 undergraduates with 90% of the students from out of state.

- 573 Putnam Pike, Greenville RI 02828. +1 401 949-3630. This library consists of a children’s area, a senior citizens area, an adult section, and teen zone. The library has all major reference books and has a computer lab. There are also a variety of programs offered to children and adults including multicultural classes, art classes, and library use classes.
- 50 Esmond Street, Smithfield, RI 02917. +1 401 231-5150. This library is in the small village of Esmond offering a good selection of books and quiet place to read.

. Putnam Pike.  This is an outdoor shopping center that has many nationally acclaimed retailers such as Target, Barnes & Noble, Home Depot, Kohl’s, F.Y.E, Old Navy, The Gap, American Eagle and Dick’s Sporting Goods, as well as others.
. Putnam Pike.  This is a strip mall where you can find the movie theater as well as stores such as TJ MAXX, CVS and Radio Shack.

content=In Conti's Plaza. Open:M-W 10:00AM-6:00PM, TH 10:00AM-8:00PM, F 10:00AM-6:00PM, and Sa 10:00AM-5:00PM. This store possesses a variety of different collections that are well known such as Vera Bradley bags and the rest of the product line. There are also some Rhode Island jewelry brands that are sold in this store that are unique. Angela Moore bracelets, necklaces, and earrings can be found in this boutique as well as Alex and Ani bracelets. Other items such as Viva Beads, shoes, purses, decorative Lolita wine glasses, as well as a baby’s clothes line can be purchased in this store. This is a well known place to shop and many locals frequent this boutique in search of great gifts or trinkets. Flaunt Boutique has recently been remodeled within the last year to be connected to the neighboring store, which is Ephraim Doumato Jewelers. The prices of products and jewelry pieces vary.
hours=Open: M-W and F 10AM -5:30PM, TH 10AM - 8PM, Sa 10AM - 4PM

content= In Conti’s Plaza. This is a family run business that provides an extensive selection of jewelry that can be purchased. Jewelry pieces such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, wedding rings and bands, and other unique items can be found in this store. Pandora charms and bracelets are also available at this location. This is another place that has frequent visitors and attracts many locals. This is connected to the neighboring store, Flaunt Boutique. The prices of jewelry pieces will vary depending on what is purchased.
content= This store offers clothing, beauty products, and accessories for women. Items such as jewelry, perfume, and candles can be found at this store. The prices will vary.

Smithfield has many chain restaurants and fast food restaurants as well as some unique family run establishments.  Chain restaurants include Uno Chicago Grill, Chilli’s, Panera Bread, Newport Creamery, Chelo’s, Ho-Ho's and Applebee’s.  Most of these restaurants are Located just off of Putnamn Pike.  Fast food includes McDonald’s, Burger King, Wendy’s, Subway, KFC, Taco Bell, and Dunkin Donuts.  Most are off of Putnam Pike.

value: . 266 Putnam Pike. +1 401 349-4130. Open: M-F 6AM - 11:30AM and Sa-S 7AM - 2PM for breakfast. Open M-F 11:00AM - 2:00PM for lunch. Open T-Sa 4:00PM - Close for dinner. This restaurant serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There are separate menus for each meal so the prices may vary.

. 460 Farnum Pike. +1 401 949-9892. This is a chain restaurant but the only A&W root beer location in Rhode Island. It is also the only "car-hop" service restaurant in Rhode Island with tray on the window service.  It is a fun place to pull up and get some great hot wieners! Every Tuesday during the summer months, local classic car collectors bring their vintage vehicles to showcase them at A&W.  There are menu specials every day; and the restaurant opens at 11AM daily.

. 352 Farnum Pike +1 401 233-1800.  Smithfield is home to one of two of Rhode Island's own Box Seats.  As the name suggests, they are sports themed.  The walls are covered in local sports memorabilia, and it tends to get loud at peek hours.  However the food is good, and it is a great place to go for lunch or dinner, especially with friends. Box Seats even makes its own bottled soda that is sold individually. Tuesday night is trivia night from 8:30-10:30.

. 332 Farnum Pike +1 401 233-1800. Del’s frozen lemonade is a Rhode Island exclusive.  A summer time favorite of almost everyone in the state, there are multiple stores and even more carts and cars located all around the state.  To truly experience Rhode Island during the late spring and summer, a cup of Del’s is a must.  This particular store has a drive through, and a walk up window, and sells soft serve ice cream.

. 445 Putnam Pike, Greenville, RI (Near the Apple Valley Mall). +1 401 233-0100. This is a small café that makes a variety of fresh bagels everyday. You can go there and sit down and eat some freshly toasted bagels and coffee or take home a dozen to your family along with their very own cream cheeses.

content=North Scituate, RI. This is actually a small family run café on the Smithfield-Scituate line. It is part of Knight’s Farm. This small charming café has delicious baked goods from pies to turnovers and muffins. It’s also a great place to get a warm breakfast of eggs and home fries and bacon. They also have great coffee and ice cream.
. 777 Putnam Pike, Greenville, RI. +1 (401) 949-3040. A hot spot in the summer months for homemade ice cream in original flavors. It sits across from the scenic Waterman’s Lake.
content=. This small bakery always has the best calzones and pizza (hot and cold) for a quick lunch or the perfect appetizers for any gathering.
content=This is another fun family style restaurant with Karaoke on Tuesday nights.

content= This is a family run Chinese restaurant in the Apple Valley Plaza. It has all the classic Chinese chain restaurant dishes like pork fried rice, beef teriyaki, chow mein, and wanton soup. It can be a little pricy compared to other American/Chinese restaurants.  There is Chinese décor inside and sometimes orders take a lot of time to come out.

content=This is an Italian bakery, which includes, pastries, pizzas, bread, gelato and calzones. Known for their pizza strips, crunchy Italian bread, and bagel pizzas. Also known for their birthday cakes. Small, café style bakery. Mid-Priced Bakery.

content=American/European food is offered here and some dishes include humus dip, fried zucchini, stuffed grape leaves, and chicken tikka. Some say the service varies from time to time. Entrees are priced between 10 and 15 dollars. There is a breakfast, lunch, dinner, and late night menu. A patio with outdoors dining is available.  Families go to this restaurant along with couples and late night singles.

content=Open for summer and spring. Fairly priced and popular ice cream shop. It is pretty clean although not the cleanest and has a variety of flavors of ice cream, hard and soft serve. The shop also serves milk shakes and iced lemonade. Families, and sports teams usually come here.

content=This is a chain restaurant that serves sushi and hibachi grill dinners. Includes a bar. Famous for sushi and fillet mignon. Dinners are priced from $9 to $21, lunches are around $9 and sushi rolls range from $5 to $10. Service is very quick and your food is almost shoved at you. Has received excellent reviews by the town although has been caught twice serving alcohol to minors.

content=This small deli is popular among the Bryant crowd, which is apparent when you try to go during lunch hours on a weekday. The sandwiches are excellent and fairly priced, and the service is usually quite fast.

content=The small diner is a great place to bring your family for breakfast any day of the week. The waitresses are very friendly, and the service is great as well. For any hash lovers, this is the place for you to go.
content=Small, family restaurant with good food and great prices. Friendly owner and wait staff make for a comfortable dining experience.
content=Great food, great service, and great price. The Kountry Kitchen is a great place to go for breakfast or lunch, and there is hardly ever a wait for a table.
content=One of a few Chinese food restaurants in Smithfield. This is the most traditional, and what you would expect from an average Chinese take-out experience.
content=Traditional pan pizza at a reasonable price. The food is good, and no matter how crowded the restaurant is, the service is always quick.

content= Breakfast and lunch is served at this location. Breakfast sandwiches, omelettes, Eggs Benedict, home fries, waffles, pancakes, and French toast are all served in this diner. Prices for breakfast meals range from $2-$7.99. The lunch menu includes spaghetti and ziti with sauce, cheese ravioli, pork chops, meatloaf dinner, gyro platters, several chicken dishes, a variety of sandwiches, and desserts. Prices for lunch meals range from $1.99-$6.49. A combination of appetizers and salads are on the menu and there are also seafood items that are available on Fridays only. The interior of the restaurant is comfortably decorated and there is a sit down bar as well as tables for seating. For the summer months and warmer weather there is an additional outdoor patio available for guests to sit at while dining.
hours=Open: M-Tu 3PM-9PM, W-Th 11:30AM-9PM, F 11:30AM-10PM, Sa 12PM-10PM, Su 12PM-9PM

content= This is a family run restaurant that serves American and Portuguese style food. The menu provides a variety of appetizers, soups, salads, sandwiches, and seafood meals. Prices range from $6.99-$26.99 depending on what is ordered and this does not include the drink menu.

content= This is a small family style restaurant that serves primarily comfort food and dishes. The inside consists of bar seating, booths, and tables for the main dining area. You can easily bring a large group of family and friends to this location for a sit down dinner.

content=This small store located next to J’s Deli provides convenient products and items. There is also a small griddle in the store that is utilized to make sandwiches, gyros, and other food options. You can also get gas at this spot for your further travels.

. 743 Putnam Pike. +1 401 349-3888. Open: M 4PM - 10PM, W-TH 4PM - 10PM, F-Sa 3PM - 11PM, and S 12PM - 9PM. This restaurant serves comfort food and meals. There is karaoke on Wednesday nights. All appetizers are half off from 4PM - 7PM on Wednesdays and Thursdays. Family style dinners are also offered from 12PM - 8PM on Sundays and children are half price. This family style meal consists of chicken, pasta, salad, and French fries.

325 Farnum Pike. +1 401 349-3500. This is a family-style pub and restaurant with 5 large-screen plasma Televisions with complete sports packages to watch any big game. There is also a stage which is used for local bands to play on the weekend. There is only a cover charge when bands are playing. The mixed drinks are small and overpriced, but the draft beer is rightfully priced.

This is a bar with a very friendly atmosphere and for some it is a place to catch up with old friends after work. On Saturday’s it is kareoke night and the perfect place to show off you singing skills.
address=45 Cedar Swamp Rd, Smithfield, RI 02828.

content=Popular bar that serves all basic malt liquors including bud light, miller light, and blue moon. It also serves various hard liquors such as vodka, captain Morgan, and gin.  It serves food as well. It is a small, clean establishment.

content= This is a family style tavern and restaurant that serves typical comfort food. This includes pizza, sandwiches, burgers, salads, wraps, and other options are also included on the menu. A drink menu is also available. This consists of a wine selection, cocktail, and beer list. There are high tables, chairs, booths, a bar seating area, and the restaurant also has several televisions throughout the interior of the tavern to create this casual atmosphere. Prices vary for the lunch, dinner, and drink menu.

content= Quality Inn is clean and comfortable, the staff members are friendly, and the breakfast choices are excellent. However, some visitors have complained about the smell of some of the rooms. It's close to Providence so if that's where you're coming in from, you won't have to travel too far.

1010 Douglas Pike. +1 401- 231-6300. Comfort Suites is clean, quiet, and cheap. The bathrooms are a bit on the small side, but this hotel has a friendly staff, good breakfast, a fitness center, and it's close to Providence.
content=Brand new hotel on Douglas Pike. Right off of 295, minutes from Lincoln, North Providence, Providence. Bryant is 3 minutes away.

Lincoln Mall- This is a strip mall located about five minutes from Smithfield on George Washington Highway. It has several stores including a Target, Starbucks, Marshalls, Home Goods, Stop and Shop, and several restaurants. It also includes Cinemaworld, a large stadium-seated cinema where movie tickets go for about ten dollars.
